text:
This is a common problem not just in HubSpot sites. Even with wordpress projects. It requires discipline/training to write CSS one way only.

One possible way to work through this if training is not an option is to have a raw.css file that they can update.... then monthly you pull that code out and add it to your less files and send them an email saying you have done so.

LESS and SASS makes things more difficult but should be embraced unless you get a mess.

I know I've suggested this in the past, but reorganizing the email client test UI would be really nice. Having that many options is nice, but organizing by OS gets really messy. Would be better to do it by client, then OS. So Gmail > chrome, firefox, explorer, etc... then Outlook > Windows 10, Windows 7, etc...
